repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: An organization dedicated to studying ancient Greek and Latin papyri. Collection houses archives of the American Society of Papyrologists, including the Society's constitution, financial papers, correspondence, Director's Office files, memoranda, and other administrative files, spanning the years 1977-1993.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
Collection has been minimally processed: items are in original order as received.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], American Society of Papyrologists Records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The American Society of Papyrologists records, were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 1997.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Encoded by Joanne Fairhurst and Paula Jeannet Mangiafico, March 2012
Accession(s) described in this finding aid: 97-012

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The American Society of Papyrologists, founded in 1961 and based at Duke University in Durham, N.C., is an organization dedicated to studying ancient papyri.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection houses archives of the American Society of Papyrologists, including the Society's constitution, financial papers, correspondence, Director's Office files, memoranda, and other administrative files, spanning the years 1977-1993. Collection has been given basic processing: items are in original order as received.
